basics.name: Eva Guttmann-Flury
basics.label: Postdoc Researcher at Shanghai Jiao Tong University
basics.summary: Deep interest in unraveling the intricacies of the brain through the development of advanced parameterized algorithms based on solid mathematical foundations. Bridging the realm of BCI with my other hobbies (Chinese culture and music) represents a captivating challenge.

work.name: Shanghai Jiao Tong University
work.summary:
Multimodal dataset for Brain-Computer Interface (BCI) application:
- Large dataset (31 subjects, 63 sessions, >46 hours) combining electroencephalography (EEG), eye-tracking, and high-speed video for ocular activity analysis across BCI paradigms
- BCI paradigms investigated: Motor Imagery (MI), Motor Execution (ME), Steady-State Visual Evoked Potentials (SSVEP), and P300

Algorithms design:
- Innovative and fast Adaptive Blink Correction and De-drifting (ABCD) for EEG pre-processing
- New dual classifier based on Source Localized Spatio-Temporal (SLST) features and Riemannian geometry, reaching an accuracy of 94%

Meta-analysis and statistical approaches:
- A priori sample size estimation (both using an online-available dataset and a prospective power analysis)
- Systematic review (21 studies) for channel selection from source localization 
- Improved quantitative and visual methods for accuracy estimation and confusion matrix representations

Post-stroke rehabilitation:
- Contributed to a project using TMS and BCI-controlled robotics with >3 health practitioners from Huashan Hospital and 4 subjects

volunteer.summary:
As part of a partnership between Shanghai Jiatong University and Dongfeng Electric, outstanding Master and PhD students are sent in high schools from remote cities (Yibin in Sichuan, China) to promote academic excellence and encourage high school students for the preparation of their highschool diploma (gaokao), which is extremely important in China.	

In July 2016, as part of a group of 5 Master and Phd, I went one week to teach in a highschool in Yibin. It was a very interesting experience, since for most of the Chinese students there, I was the first foreigner they saw in real life.

projects.name: Rehabilitation in Huashan Hospital, Shanghai (China)
projects.summary:
As part of a partnership between Shanghai Jiaotong University and Huashan Hospital, our Brain-Computer Interface laboratory carries on rehabilitation improvement analysis on stroke patients. Our group consists of 7 Masters and PhD, that alternates the patients treatment and the setting up of the needed equipment.

This project is still on going, but preliminary results tend to show an improvement of the rehabilitation process.

projects.name: Les Ambulances de l'Espoir, Humanitarian Project
projects.summary:
"Les Ambulances de l'Espoir" is a humanitarian project aiming at collecting old ambulances in Loire-Atlantique (French region) in order to give them to countries in need of health equipments and first aids.

Our mission focused on:
- Centralizing and data analyzing on the identification of the given vehicles as well as redacting the International vehicle transport files
- Contacting and establishing good working relations with ambulance sponsors, benefactors acting as intermidiaires (Lions Clubs) and humanitarian associations for the vehicle transport
- Developing of a communication strategy to increase awareness
- Organizing of the official ambulance handover to the humanitarian associations (held the 29th of September 2011)
